"Not at all my dear." he replied. He waited as she took a few steps out of the cave before adding, "I hope you weren't planning on going out at this time of night."

"What?" asked Nala wondering what he was up to now.

"It is dangerous out on the Savana at night. There are lots of animals that roam the grounds looking for food. Imagine their surprise if they found such a plump treat just wondering around... alone."

Nala didn't like the sound of this, but she wasn't sure how much he was simply exagerating to get her to stay. She knew it was dangerous as her mother constantly told her and Simba not to wonder off at night.

"Well, what did you have in mind?" she asked.

"I already sent word to your mother. She knows where you are. Tommorow you can go home... after a little breakfast."

Nala didn't like that part he included. She was getting more and more frightened by the moment, but if she had to remain the night she had no choice. Scar led her past the remaining hippo meat and further into the cave. She doubted it'd be long before she'd have her face in it whether she wanted to or not. When they reached Scar's sleeping corner, covered in dried grass Scar brushed some to Nala for her to make her own bed. Laying down she found it not as comfortable as her bed at home. Instead she found her meaty body more relaxing to her. She knew that nothing bad could happen while she slept. She figured if she woke up early enough she could sneak out before Scar realized she was gone.
1112122112121.title: Trapped

choices: Nala eats her way through and escapes.
Nala eats her way through, but she could stand to eat some more.
11121221121211.content: Nala's eyes opened up to darkness. It took her a moment to gather her thoughts and realize Scar's lair was too dark to even tell the difference between day and night. After she checked to make sure Scar was asleep she made her way out of the cave. As more and more light entered into the cave to light her way she felt more excitement about escaping, but the light also reaveal a blockade in her way. The hippo's body had been positioned to block the cave's entrance, not to mention a few more large animal bodeis had been added to fill in the gaps in the blockade. If she had been a few pounds lighter it might have been possible to climb over it, but she was in no shape to do that now. Her only other option was to eat her way through the meat and she was glad she had already digested and was able to eat again. And she began making her way through the wall with haste, but to savor it all at the same time.
11121221121211.title: A barrier.

111212211212112.content:
Nala was greatful her stomach had already become adjusted to quickly digesting her big meals. allowing her to even be able to attempt to eat through the barrier. Her sense of urgency to escape was also there as motivation as she tucked in and began scarfing down the food like she had never had before. She chewed and swallowed quickly, not allowing herself much time to taste the food as it ran down her stomach. To eat a hole to the other side was going to be the same as feasting like she never had before. The only thought she had in her mind at the time was that she had to get out of here before Scar finds her. At least that's what she thought at first.

As she continued to eat her normal desires of obesity emerged to cover up her fears again. She slowed down to savor the flavor and reach a pace to allow herself to eat as much as possible. Before long she succeeded in her original goal of making a hole through the hippo to her salvation, but she lost all interest in that for the moment. Instead she began eating around the sides fo the hippo before turning to start on some of the other animals that had been added. She hadn't put much thought into it, but she was easily eating an overwhelming amount of food that an adult lioness would end up being sick to her stomach after consuming and she had continued to eat. She had finally managed to blossom into the glutton she truely wanted to be and Scar, who had been lurking in the shadows since the beginning, smirked as he observed her.

She soon slowed down as the food finally caught up with her and fullness came, but Nala still kept eating. It was hardly a nibble, but she just wanted more. Her stomach wouldn't stop telling her to eat and in her mind she didn't want to stop either. She couldn't stop wanting to eat if she wanted to and she loved it. Still, Scar could see that she was already full and decided to see if his little guest was going to be a little more cooperative and not try and eat and run.
111212211212112.title: Greedy Glutton

11121221121212.content: Where does she wake up?
11121221121212.title: She wakes up later.

choices: A inescapable pit filled with food
111212211212122.content: Where does she wake up?
111212211212122.title: wake up somewhere else.

choices: Nala finds it hard to eat with everybody watching her.
1112122112121221.content:
Nala awoke, but before her eyes opened she could smell tons of meat nearby of different varieties. She could only devise that Scar had awoken already and brought her breakfast. She figured that as long as she appeared to be asleep she could make a run for the cave entrance. With that she leapt to her feet. With her meal digested her stomach had shrunk, though a considerable amount of fat was added to her body rounding it out, but there was no time to look at herself. However, as fast as she got to her feet she came to a halt seeing that not only was she not where she fell asleep, but in a pit much to steep to climb and piled with tons of meat. To make matters worse, Scar was staring down at her with some hyenas at his side.

"I can see your stomach settle by the way you can move. I guess that means you're ready to eat now. Don't worry about the amount of food in there... I can always send my hyenas out for more."

Nala knew this pasted the board line between helpful and psychotic quite some time ago and she had to put a stop to this. "Why are you so obsessed with fattening me up?" she growled. "Sure I wanted to get fat, but not this way."

Scar chuckled at her words already prepared with a response. "My dear, you will undoubtedly be the queen of the Pridelands one day won't you?" he asked.

"I guess so. I've never really put too much thought in it."

"Well, even so, as your royal subjects we must obeys your orders and fulfill your desires. Please forgive us, but we only do this to make you happy. We do not wish you any harm."

Nala didn't want to believe Scar's words anymore, but as things were she couldn't get out of this mess. She could only wait for someone to rescue her, but with Scar's cleverness it could be a long stay. Still, the food did look good and she was feeling famished.
1112122112121221.title: Luxorious Kidnapping

choices: Scar comes for his daily visit.
11121221121212211.content:
Nala didn't have much of a choice of whether or not she could leave the cave anymore. All she had was the choice to eat and with an empty belly that made the answer simple. She ate slowly, afraid of the Hyenas above. They let out wicked cackles that made her wonder if they were about to attack her or if they were trying to simply scare her. Whatever the reason they didn't so much as lay a paw on her. In time they wander around a bit, getting bored with her just staring at them. They didn't even need to watch her as escape was already impossible. With them gone she went back to her meal.

As day turned to night or night to day, since Nala quickly lost track of time in the cave, Nala wondered what her family was doing. Were they looking for her or had Scar already tricked them with some sort of lie. Whatever the case, Nala never felt so alone. She eventually grew tired and decided to fall asleep.

When she awoke, she quickly remembered her situation and paced around her pit of a home, checking to see if the hyenas were still about. They were, though most were lazing around, bored. Nala had always been taught to be fearful of the beasts, but after being at their mercy for so long and not being harmed she felt somewhat relaxed around them. She even lost some of her fear and hate for her uncle since he did seem to go through all the trouble to get all this food for her. As Nala's mind raced through all this information, she realized she was hungry again and started eating again, but before long she found she had just about run out. Nala knew Scar told her she could ask for more, but was he being serious. She nervously tried to get one of the hyena's attention.

"Uh, Mr. Hyena." she began.

"I'm not a Mr." replied the hyena Nala was trying to talk to who was apparently a female. "My name is Gina."

"Hello, Gina." Nala said. Nala was surprised by how friendly she acted towards her. If the circumstances were different they could've become friends. It seemed even possible that they could become friends even now. "Uh, I'm almost out of food and Scar said I could ask for more."

"More food?" replied Gina. "Don't worry, a few of the others went out earlier. They should be back soon. We figured you might need more soon."

Nala became excited by her words and replied with a loud, "Thank You!" Her voice echoed through the cave. Nala felt embarrassed and the hyenas all gave their usual chuckled that seemed less sinister to Nala and more like a heartful laugh to her ears. Nala was actually beginning to like it in the cave like it was a second home and though it was dark, she felt her future was going to be bright.

Days passed and became weeks and then months as Nala spent her time eating, sleeping, and having chats with Gina and the other hyenas. Her schedual of doing those things was whenever she felt like it since a normal schedual by what time of day it was didn't apply to her sunless life. She had grown very fat through her meals and lack of exercise. The feedings grew even more intense as well. They had to fill the pit up with so much food to satisfy Nala eventually that they buried her alive. They'd all laugh hysterically upon seeing her like that and Nala had grown to love their laugh. She even developed a laugh of her own, but it sounded so wierd it made the hyenas laugh even more. When Scar made his daily visits to see Nala or at least how big she was, Nala was just as friendly with him as with all the others.

"How is my little princess" he would always begin with.

As he looked Nala over, her gut had made her lose ground clearance a while ago. Her feet were coverd by flab. Her tail a thick sausage and much shorter because of her obese rump that had comsumed most of it. The hyenas laughed at her past attempts to try and wag it. Her chins had doubled then tripled before she lost count of them. her face was much rounded, swollen with fat. If it wasn't talking to the hyenas or eating, it was resting on her bed of chins. Nala was practically a ball of fat.

It eventually became a problem keeping her in the pit, however, as her home was becoming too snuck. It took a lot of work, but after tying vines to Nala and filling the pit with water, they managed to get her out. From there, she was able to see more of the cave, but it was still just a whole lot of dark. Still, it felt like she was moving into a new home, closer to her friends, which was true since she got to eat with them now. They even enjoyed feeding her themselves, trying to see if they could even get Nala full. Nala always won of course.

Nala loved it there and could never imagine living anywhere else.
11121221121212211.title: Nala's Lion Den

1112122112122.content:
Nala continues to chow down on the hippo until a good cavern was forged in its side and her belly had ballooned almost to the ground. She sat back on her slightly rounder hind end and panted, her front paws draped over her taught gut and hind paws splayed out to the sides.

Scar, in spite of being surprised by her ability to put it away, coolly said, "Is that it? You've hardly touched that hippo!"

Nala panted and moaned. "I ... can't eat any more. There's too much."

"Come now," he walked over to her, "those aren't the words of the little lioness I talked to the other day! If you want to be fat, you must ... <i>eat</i>." The last word came out in a slight growl, and Nala's fear quickly returned. What on earth was he up to?

In any event, Nala returned to gulping down bite after bite of hippo meat (this was mostly fat, so this meal would leave her much larger than any of the previous) and even though she began slowing down, the tight, round mass below her steadily grew until she could no longer lift it from the ground. She mumbled and tried to walk, first dragging it, then trying to roll. The rolling just left her feeling nauseated , so scratch that.

"N-no ... no m-more ... r-r-room."

"So ... is that your final answer?"

Nala hiccuped and moaned, rubbing her gut with her paws. "Yeah. No more."
1112122112122.title: Nala eventually falls asleep while eating.

11121221121221.content:
Scar sighed. "Then I see that I must take matter's into my own hands." He stuck his head out of his cave and gave a quiet call.

In walked 4 or 5 hyena's. None of them the three any would recognise but just generic Hyena's.

"What's going on?" Nala said eyeing the Hyena's. Who in turn eyed her like she was dinner.

"It seem's my guest no longer wish'd to dine on the meal we caught." He said sounding almost hurt.

One of the Hyena's growled causing Nala to back up....if she could.

"My thought's exactly. I don't wish for you and your kin's collective work to go to waste. So I really must insist that you help this girl finish what was caught for her."

"Nala's eye's widened like plate as she tried to scramble. Ultimatly failing.

The Hyen'as started tearing meat off the Hippo and bringing it over to her.

"Now now dear. Your being extremly rude. So to keep my friend's, how you say..'sated' I'm afraid your going to have to get your appitite back and...eat...the...whole....thing!"

With that said the first Hyena shoved it's face into hers. Feeding her like a bird it crammed the faty meat into her maw and stayed theyre until she had to choice but to eat it or risk not breathing.

"Good girl." Said Scar as he watched his guest's renewwed growth in girth.
11121221121221.title: Force-feed her

choices: "I am going to need some help."
111212211212211.content:
Nala was crying it hurt so bad. She couldn't believe she had ever desired to get fat. All the happiness it brought he was being twisted by her uncle. She was even eating anymore. They just shoved it into her gut and somehow made room. Her only relief was that she didn't see a trace of hippo meat, but she was quite surprised she could hold tons of hippoey goodness inside of her. She doubted any less lioness would swear off anything larger than a leg of a gazzelle after an experience like this.

"My you sure live to eat." remarked Scar in his casual voice that ignored everything that just transpired. "Of course I figured you'd have a little room left over so I got you your favorate, some zebra."

Nala's eyes bulged as a whole zebra was brought in. It wasn't anything compared to the hippo, but she didn't think she could fit anymore food in her body.

"Why are you doing this?" she cried, begging for mercy.

"You should be greatful. I'm giving you exactly what you want. I'm giving you food and helping you get fat. I've even eliminated everything in your path. In here you're mother isn't keeping you from food and with my friends here you aren't limiting yourself by how much you think you can eat. You ate the hippo didn't you. Once you've freed yourself of what you believe is the maximum amount of food you can eat then you'll be able you reach your goal of being fat. So what do you say? Are you ready to eat on your own or do you need some more asistance. I leave you with those two choices since I believe you have great potential and I won't let you quit on yourself."

Nala felt strangely encouraged by Scar's words. She feared him, but at the same time she clung to his every word. It seemed to even sooth her bulging stomach. She then opened her mouth and answered,
111212211212211.title: Next Meal and Nala's Limit

1112122112122111.content: "I can eat it myself." Even to her own ears, though, Nala sounded doubtful. As much as she'd grown recently, the zebra still dwarfed her, and she'd already eaten so much that she wasn't sure if she could cram it all in. But Scar's words had lit a strange fire in her overstuffed stomach, so she bellied up to the carcass and started, slowly but steadily, to eat.
1112122112122111.title: "I can eat it myself."

11121221121221111.content:
Nala made her way methodically through the zebra, savoring every bite of meat as though she hadn't eaten for a week. Her stomach strained to contain all the food the young lioness was stuffing into it, but Nala couldn't feel the pain. Every bit of her attention was focused on the pleasure of consumption. A heard of elephants could have stampeded by and she would not have noticed, so caught up was she in her own little world of gluttony. As she ate, her poor stomach ballooned further and further until it lifted her legs off of the ground, spreading them as though she was lying on some large animal instead of her own gut.

She was surprised to find, eventually, that there was no more zebra in front of her. Once she'd eaten herself into temporary immobility, Scar had (unbeknownst to Nala, of course) commanded his hyenas to constantly push the remaining meat up to her so all she had to do was open her mouth and there was another bite of flesh waiting for her. Thus is was that she didn't even realize her lack of mobility until after she'd realized that she had eaten the whole zebra.

And even then, she didn't seem overly concerned with her lack of mobility. She just craned her neck back and forth as best she could, looking for more to eat. Scar was impressed. He had hoped that his little speech would inspire the cub, but he hadn't expected her to do this well!

"How do you feel, my dear?" he asked smoothly. When there was no answer, he padded around to where he could see Nala's head. The young lioness had fallen fast asleep. When the hyenas saw what was going on, they went to get more meat, to continue force-feeding Nala, but Scar held up a paw. "There will be no need for that any more, I think. Our young guest has earned her rest, and I doubt we'll need to force-feed her again.

The next morning, when Nala wakes up...
11121221121221111.title: She finishes it all

111212211212211111.content:
...She found that whatever stupor she had been in the night before had worn off. She was hungry again, but not ravenously so: She hadn't finished digesting her huge meal. Nala groaned and lifted herself to her feet. It was a difficult task, and for a moment she remembered how she'd immobilized herself the night before and thought in a panic that she wouldn't be able to get up at all. But no, she eventually managed to get herself up on all fours, though it took longer than she was used to. Since she hadn't fully digested her last meal, her belly still hung low and heavy between her legs, which messed up her center of gravity.

Slowly, unused to her new weight, Nala waddled toward the mouth of the den. As she walked, she absently wondered what it would be like to have a belly like this all the time, not just when it was full of food. She was initially unhappy with the idea, since moving her colossal stomach was such a pain, but she thought back to the night before and how food had just kept appearing in her mouth. If she could find a way to live like that all the time, semi-mobility wouldn't be so bad, especially since it would allow her to eat as much as she desired.

All of a sudden, Scar bounded into the mouth of the den, standing between the bloated young lioness and freedom. Nala shrank back instinctively, but didn't know why. After all, Scar had been nothing but helpful to her. Even the force-feeding had been in Nala's best interests.

"And just where do you think you're going, young lady?" Scar asked.

"I'm going home," Nala replied. "My mom and dad will worry about me if I'm gone too long. Y-you're not going to try to stop me, are you?" In her present condition (not to mention the fact that she was still only a cub), there was no way she would be able to overpower a full-grown lion. But Scar's thin mouth broke into a wide grin.

"Of course not, my dear. After the way you proved yourself last night, you're free to go whenever you want." As if to prove his point, he slithered out of her way, leaving her with a clear view of the den entrance. "I just thought you might like some breakfast before you go, to sustain you through the long journey back."

On Scar's signal, two hyenas dragged an antelope carcass out where Nala could see--and, more importantly, smell--it. In spite of how full she still was, the young lioness found herself salivating at the thought of eating more, but she was already dangerously low on mobility. If she ate the whole antelope (and she knew that if she started, she would eat the whole thing), she could be stuck here while she digested.
111212211212211111.title: Scar allows her to return home.

choices: Scar keeps her too stuffed to move
1112122112122111111.content:
As much as Nala wanted to see her parents again, the smell of the antelope was too good for the cub to resist. She dragged herself over to the carcass and dug in, ripping off great hunks of the animal's flesh as though her belly wasn't already distended from the previous night's binge. As before, Nala quickly lost what little mobility she had, and it was up to the hyenas to make sure she was still able to feed herself.

The antelope carcass disappeared quickly, and when it was gone, Nala was immobilized but so drunk off the fantastic feeling of stuffing herself that she didn't realize it. She tried to push herself toward the exit on paws that only barely reached the ground, but didn't make much progress.

Seeing her struggle, Scar said, "Come now, Nala. That tiny antelope couldn't have filled you up. Have a bit more, won't you?"

The hyenas dragged a zebra up to her, and after that it was automatic. Nala had flipped her eating switch when she'd taken the first bite of the antelope, and now she couldn't have stopped if she wanted to. Not that she did want to: Eating beyond all rational limit was a euphoric sensation to her, and she would stop only when she couldn't force down another bite.

This morning, that point was midway through the zebra and, just as had happened the night before, she fell asleep as soon as her body realized that she wasn't able to eat any more.
1112122112122111111.title: Stay and Eat

11121221121221111112.content:
Nala's life continued on like this for days--not that she registered the passage of time. The young lioness' existence now consisted solely of eating and sleeping. Whenever she would wake up and make a move to leave, Scar would ply her with more food, and she would lose herself in the delights of gluttony once again. For all Nala could tell, her life since sneaking out to meet Scar that fateful night had been one long feast. As she continued down her near-drugged path into immobility, what little will she had eroded, until Scar didn't even have to bother with the pretense of giving her food for the journey home. If he put meat where the cub could get at it, she would devour it, no prompting necessary.

Since she never slept long enough to fully digest the huge feasts she was scarfing down her every waking moment, Nala's stomach never lost its distended appearance, and if anything only grew more massive as the lioness blossomed into a nearly mindless glutton. Her legs never touched the ground any longer, and were in fact pushed out almost horizontally by her ballooning gut. Because of this, the muscles in her legs began to atrophy, so that even if by some miracle she stopped eating long enough to fully digest and the resulting weight gain didn't leave her permanently immobile, she would have trouble moving her ever-increasing bulk with her ever-weakening legs.
11121221121221111112.title: Too Stuffed to Move

111212211212211111122.content: All right. Who's it gonna be?
111212211212211111122.title: Someone stumbles onto her

1112122112122111111221.content:
One morning (or was it afternoon? Time was an indistinct blur delineated only by alternating periods of food and sleep), Nala awoke groggily only to find that Scar was nowhere to be found. She looked around as best she could with her rather limited field of vision; she called out for the lion and even for the hyenas. Nothing. For once, she was apparently all alone.

She wasn't happy about that. Her immense stomach, so used to being constantly fed, grumbled in protest that Nala had been up a full minute and yet it wasn't getting any food. The lioness was inclined to agree with her gut. She rather enjoyed being able to eat to her capacity and beyond without actually having to move, and the fact that she could find neither any of her helpers nor anything to munch on until they got back distressed her greatly. Scar could have at least left something in front of her to tide her over if he knew he was going to be gone for such an extended period of time--though, in truth, it had barely been any time at all since Nala had woken up.

The young lioness had long since become truly and permanently immobile, so all she could do was stew atop her huge stomach and wait for Scar or his lackeys to return. For the first time in... well, in she didn't know how long, Nala wished she could move under her own power. Immobility was fantastic--when there was someone around to feed her. As the seconds ticked by and no friendly face appeared with food, she began to get seriously (if irrationally) worried that she was going to starve to death.

Then, all of a sudden, she heard something outside the cave. It sounded like someone trying to be sneaky, which was odd. The only people she ever saw were Scar and his hyenas, and none of them would have felt the need to creep around. That meant it was a stranger. Nala obviously couldn't hide herself, so she settled for closing her eyes and tucking her plump head as far back into her monstrously fat body as it would go. She could hear the intruder enter, and she held her breath, hoping that whoever it was would mistake her for a rock or something, but the interloper padded straight up to her and pressed their nose into her flank.

The pressure subsided after a moment, and she heard the intruder breath, "What in the world?" It had been a while since she'd heard it, but Nala would know that voice anywhere.

"Simba?" she asked, daring to raise her head. The young lion moved wonderingly into her field of vision and indeed, it was Simba, who was staring up at her with huge, round eyes.

"Nala!?" he exclaimed. "What happened to you? You..."
1112122112122111111221.title: Simba finds her

11121221121221111112212.content:
"...look so beautiful! What have you been doing?"

"Eating, mostly," Nala said. "And speaking of, I haven't had anything to eat all day." Well, that could have been true, since she didn't know what time of day it was. "Do you have any food on you?"

Simba shook his head, still clearly in awe of Nala's new form. "N-no, sorry." When he saw her chubby face fall, he added "But I can go hunt if you'd like!"

"I'd really appreciate that, Simba," she responded coyly. Like Nala herself, Simba was still a cub, so his hunting abilities were limited, but at this point, Nala would take all the help she could get.
11121221121221111112212.title: Beautiful

choices: "If you have a problem with it, you can leave."
111212211212211111122122.content:
Simba tried to dash out of the den as quickly as he could while still keeping his eyes on Nala, so he didn't notice when Scar appeared in the mouth of the den; he slammed right into the older lion.

"Well, well, well, what do we have here?" Scar said, picking the cub up with his forepaws. "The little prince! Good afternoon, Simba! What brings you to my humble abode?"

"I was going to go find some food for Nala," Simba answered meekly. He hadn't been doing anything wrong, exactly, but no matter how gorgeous Nala had become since he'd last seen her, the cub (being a cub) was a little embarrassed to be so obviously smitten. Heck, right up until he'd seen Nala in all of her glory, Simba had been convinced that all girls had fleas.

"Happily, the young lady won't have to rely on your hunting skills," the older lion said silkily. The insult went right over Simba's head, because at that moment, a cackle of hyenas dragged in what looked to be a freshly-killed zebra. Simba saw how Nala's eyes lit up at the sight of food, and against his better instincts, he wished that she would look at him like that.

"C-can I stay while you eat?" Simba asked, but Nala's face was already buried in her meal, and she didn't look up at the sound of Simba's voice. "Nala?"

"Let her eat," Scar admonished. "You can stay if you'd like, as long as you don't bother Nala." That was fine with Simba, so he sat down and watched Nala stuff herself.

It was...incredible. As massive as she was for her age, Nala was still much smaller than a full-grown zebra, and yet she ate like the carcass was just a light snack, stuffing down what must have been several times her body weight in meat. As she ate, her already-sizable flanks ballooned visibly, until Simba was afraid that she would pop like a bubble--and that was with nearly a third of the zebra left! His romantic fascination was now matched by a morbid one, as he waited for her to explode. He wanted to cry out for her to stop, but he remembered what Scar had told him and so held his tongue.

And, of course, she didn't stop. Simba understood how Nala had blossomed from a scrawny cub to an immobile beauty in just a few weeks, if she ate like this every day. He noticed that the hyenas who had brought in the zebra made sure that Nala had to move as little as possible to get another bite, and deep down, he envied them. He wanted to be the one right up close to the gorging lioness. He saw her fat toes curl as she continued binging, and realized all of a sudden that the noises she was making as she ate weren't from the pain of her overstuffed belly, but from pleasure.

Finally, she had finished the whole zebra. She looked around blinkingly, as if she was coming out of a trance. Simba opened his mouth to tell her how amazing that was, but Scar cut him off.

"How do you feel, my dear?"

"Is there any more food?"

"But of course," Scar replied, and motioned for the hyenas to bring in the next course. Simba's eyes bulged. It was an eland, and it was, if anything, bigger than the zebra had been. Mouth agape, he looked at Nala, but she didn't seem at all worried about the danger of consuming such a large animal. She just watched the hyenas drag it toward her, a contented, almost sleepy smile on her face.

"You can't eat that whole thing!" Simba cried. "You'll explode!" Scar looked at the cub sharply, a hint of a snarl on his lips. The dark-furred lion had worked hard to get Nala to her current state, and if Mufasa's son thought that he was going to shake her out of it, he had another thing coming.

But Scar underestimated how much Nala wanted to keep eating. At Simba's outburst, she looked over at the cub as though registering his presence for the first time. She opened her mouth and said...
111212211212211111122122.title: Scar comes home

choices: Simba makes Nala eat even more
Simba stays cuddled up to Nala while she sleeps
1112122112122111111221221.content:
"Would you like to feed me?" Simba was so flabbergasted by the question that he sat down involuntarily. Scar bit back a snicker, but Nala just smiled. "I'm serious. Then you'll see how much I can eat."

"Y-yes!" Simba said hurriedly. God, he wanted nothing else. "What do I have to do?"

"Just make sure that the eland is always by my mouth. I can't exactly run around to find more of it." For emphasis, she slapped her massive flank with one thick, useless paw. Even as stuffed as she was, it jiggled a little, and Simba was mesmerized by the hypnotic motion of fat under fur.

Without waiting for him to do anything else, Nala dug in. Hurriedly, Simba darted over to the carcass, ready to move it closer to Nala as she needed it. Even when he was this close, Nala didn't seem to really see him, or at least she didn't acknowledge his presence. Instead, she buried her fat face in the carcass and ate like she was starving.

Simba had some trouble moving the eland, which was of course much bigger than he was. At one point, Nala actually ran out of meat within reach, and she looked up with a strangled cry, worried that she'd finished the whole thing already. Simba hurriedly, and with a burst of strength, pushed the remaining carcass back up to her, and she resumed eating like nothing had happened. Keeping the meat close to her got easier as she ate, since there was less meat to push, but Simba was still slow and clumsy at it because he was so fascinated by watching her eat and grow. As before, she didn't seem concerned with the seeming impossibility of eating so much. She just kept glutting herself as though every bite was her first.

It was the most beautiful thing Simba had ever seen. Her stomach expanded bit by bit as she ate until she was bigger than the remaining meat. She scarfed that down too; Simba fed her the last few bites, which were too low to the ground for the massive lioness to reach, himself, and was disappointed that there was nothing left for her to eat. Nala's eyes were glazed over from her massive display of gluttony, and she still didn't seem to notice him. He pressed himself up against her taut side, imagining the vast quantities of meat it contained all turned to soft, pliable fat. The thought of making Nala even bigger thrilled him in a way that made the cub a little uncomfortable.
1112122112122111111221221.title: Simba Feeds Nala

11121221121221111112212211.content:
He couldn't get the idea of Nala being even bigger out of his head.

"Did you guys catch anything else?" he asked hopefully.

"Don't worry about me. I'm fine," Nala said dazedly.

"Yes, we were fortunate enough to take down another eland," Scar replied, eying his massively engorged charge.

"Well, feed it to her!" Simba said impatiently.

"Are you sure?"

"I'm the prince of the Pride Lands! Of course I'm sure! And what's more, you have to do what I say!" Simba said as authoritatively as he could manage. The hyenas laughed uproariously at his attempt to command them, but Scar held up a paw to silence them.

"Whatever you command, Simba," he said silkily, with a little bow. It galled him to pretend like Simba had any authority over anything, but if the little brat wanted to overfeed Nala, so be it. Let the cub be the bad guy. It would only drive Nala closer to Scar.

Once again, this animal was bigger than the last one had been--twice the size of the other eland, in fact--but far from the apprehension Simba had felt last time, the hugeness of the animal excited him. There was no way he would be able to move this carcass himself, so he commanded the hyenas to resume feeding her. They obeyed, but only (unbeknownst to Simba) after Scar nodded.

"I don't think I can eat this," Nala groaned as the new meat was pushed up against her.

"Yes you can," Simba urged. "You can eat anything!" Nala nodded groggily and started to eat again, but she was going far too slowly for Simba's taste. "If she can't eat, force her," Simba said. The illicitness of forcing this huge glutton to eat more than even she wanted only made the whole thing more exciting for him.

After surreptitiously checking with Scar again, the hyenas did as Simba commanded them. They stuffed hunk after hunk of meat into Nala's mouth, and she swallowed mechanically, in too much of a stupor to do much else. Simba was no longer sure if the noises she was making were from pleasure, pain or some combination of the two. But it didn't matter. She was expanding, growing ever larger, and Simba was pleased.

Finally, the last of the second eland disappeared into Nala's enormously overstuffed gut. The young lioness lay motionless on top of her mountainous stomach, panting and groaning.

"I'll leave you two alone," Scar said with a smirk. When Nala realized what had happened, all her ire would be directed at Simba, not at him.
11121221121221111112212211.title: Simba's Pleasure

111212211212211111122122112.content:
"Are you okay?" Simba asked, walking to where Nala could definitely see him. Now that the moment had passed, he worried that he'd overdid it. Nala probably knew her limits (then again, from looking at her, maybe she didn't...), and he hadn't meant to seriously harm her.

Nala groaned. "Scar did that to me once," she said thickly.

"Did what?" Simba said, not comprehending.

"Force-fed me. It was a long time ago."

"And...?" Simba wasn't sure where this was going. He was apprehensive that she was going to yell at him."

"It was really scary when he did it. I thought I was going to die." She paused, running her paws up and down as much of her colossal paunch as she could reach. "It wasn't so scary when you did it. I know you'd never hurt me, and I like that you're helping me eat more than I could on my own. I really do want to get fat."

Simba looked her over. "Are you saying that you're not fat now?" he asked incredulously. "I mean--don't take that the wrong way. I really like you like this, but, um--"

"No, I know what you mean," she said, laughing. "And I guess I am pretty fat. But I love to eat, and I love how it feels when my stomach's distended. You gave me that feeling better than I've ever been able to do it myself."

"What do you mean?"

"I mean, if you want to feed me like that every day, I'd like it."

Of course, Simba jumped at the chance to do something so pleasurable all the time. Their time together quickly settled into a routine: Nala would eat as much as she could on her own, and then Simba would force her to eat more, always at least as much as she'd consumed "willingly." Sometimes she'd cry or beg him to stop, but he knew better than to listen to her pleas, and afterwards, she would always reassure him that he'd done the right thing.

As a result of her greatly increased food intake, Nala's weight skyrocketed. It was impossible to tell how much of that was food weight, since Nala was always at least full and usually stuffed far past that point, but she was definitely the biggest lion Simba had ever seen. The pair soon grew into young adult lions, Simba growing strong from his constant hefting of Nala's massive meals, and Nala, well, Nala grew very, very fat.

She'd been immobile since before Simba had found her, of course, but now she was almost completely round. Her paws had completely vanished, buried beneath the rolls of her fat legs, and her legs themselves were partially obscured by the rest of her. But her crowning glory was her stomach, which pushed her up off the ground til her head would have been even with a small human's. It flowed out from beneath her, making her as wide as she was tall. And Simba loved her for it.
111212211212211111122122112.title: A Beautiful Friendship

choices: She makes it home all right
Night falls, and she has to stop
1112122112122111112.content:
Nala shook her head. "Thank you for...for everything. But I have to go home." She felt bad about leaving when Scar so obviously wished she would stay, but if she didn't go now, she'd probably never be able to get up the willpower to leave. Scar sighed.

"Very well. Thank you for the pleasure of your company, and please remember that you're welcome back here any time."

"I-I will." And with that, the bloated young lioness started off. The way her hanging paunch brushed the ground wasn't unpleasant, but she wasn't used to the new weight. The journey from Scar's den back to her parents' was a long one, even under optimal conditions, and in her current shape, it took much longer than normal: Her walk itself was slower, to compensate for her pendulous gut, and she kept having to stop and rest. More than once along the way, she wished that she had taken up Scar's offer and had a bite to eat before she left, because she was positively starving.
1112122112122111112.title: The Journey Home

choices: Nala accepts her new diet as best she can
11121221121221111121.content:
Despite her difficulties, Nala eventually made it back to her parents' den. As soon as she was inside, she collapsed in a fat little heap, panting from exhaustion. She hoped that she had made it back in time for dinner. From father back in the den, her father raised his head.

"Nala? Where have you been young lady!? Your mother and I have been worried sick ab--" The lion stopped mid-censure as he took in his daughter's new, rounder form. "What happened to you?" he demanded. "Did you eat an elephant?"

"No," Nala said, hoping that he wouldn't ask about too many other animals. She curled into herself, trying to make herself look smaller so her dad would go easy on her, but there wasn't much she could do about her stomach.

"Wait until your mother sees what's happened to you," her father said, bounding over her and out of the cave. "Don't go anywhere, you!" he added over his shoulder.

Nala didn't want to go anywhere. She was miserable. She had expected her parents to be happy to have her home, but all her dad seemed to care about was her weight. Like it was any of his business if she liked to eat! Nala's stomach growled, since she hadn't eaten anything all day. Dismally, she hoped that she wasted away to nothing before her parents got back; it would serve them right if she died of starvation. It didn't occur to her that she was maybe overreacting a little.

She didn't manage to die before her parents returned.

"My goodness, dear, you were right!" her mother, Sarafina, said as she looked Nala over. "Well, we'll just have to make sure she eats right from now on." Seeing the horror on Nala's face, she added, "Oh, don't worry, Nala! We don't intend to starve you! Here, I brought you some dinner."

She dropped part of a zebra leg in front of the chubby cub. For any normal lion of Nala's age, it would have been a perfectly satisfying meal, but after her revelatory binge with Simba's uncle, Nala had grown to desire bigger and better things. She finished the meat quickly and felt like she hadn't eaten anything at all.

"Can I have some more?" Nala asked sweetly, putting on her saddest, most innocent expression. Unfortunately, Sarafina saw right through her.

"No, Nala. That was more than enough meat for a cub like you. If you don't watch your eating, how are you going to lose that extra weight?"

Maybe I don't want to lose the weight, Nala thought sullenly, but she didn't say as much out loud. She didn't know how she was going to survive on such pitiful amounts of food.
11121221121221111121.title: Home Again Home Again

111212211212211111211.content:
Nala tried her best to diet like her parents wanted; she really did. But the lack of food made her cranky, and her parents weren't budging an inch on the whole weight loss thing. After about a week of near starvation, Nala decided that she couldn't take it any more. Her parents were keeping a close eye on her, to make sure she didn't sneak any food and ruin her diet, but that day, Sarafina was out hunting with the other lionesses, so Nala played the good little cub for her father, until he dozed off to sleep. That was her chance. As quietly as she could, Nala bolted out of her parents' den.

They wanted to see less of her bulk? Fine. They'd never have to look at it again.
111212211212211111211.title: Runaway

choices: Her parents come looking for her
1112122112122111112111.content:
Nala felt that her only option was to go back to Scar, apologize for leaving, and hope that he let her stay. She couldn't go to any of her friends at Pride Rock, partly because she didn't know how they'd react to her new weight, but mostly because they'd almost certainly turn her in to her parents, and she couldn't have that. Her bitterness toward them had only grown since she'd set out, and (aside from hunger, of course), the impetus driving her forward was the thought of punishing her parents for trying to starve her to death.

Even though she was wasting away to practically nothing, Nala found she had an easier time getting back to Scar's den than she had going home. It was probably just anticipation that made her feet light.

Scar was sunning himself outside his den when he heard Nala's approach. His thin lips twisted into a smile. He'd almost given up hope that the cub would return to him. It had been nearly a week, and he was seriously beginning to worry that all his work had been for nothing. But no, his faith in Nala was completely justified. He closed his eyes as she approached, pretending to sleep so she wouldn't know that he had been watching her.

She nudged the side of his head, and he opened his eyes and yawned theatrically. "Nala!" he exclaimed with faux-surprise. "I wasn't expecting to see you back so soon! How are things back home?"

"My parents tried to starve me!" she replied bitterly. Scar had to suppress another smile. He couldn't have asked for a more perfect response. Nala was obviously in an emotionally unstable state, and he could use that to his advantage.

"Well, as I wasn't expecting you, I don't have any food for you at the moment, but if you'd care to wait, I can send the hyenas out to catch something."

Nala nodded. She guessed she could survive a little longer if she definitely got to eat something soon.

As the two lions waited for the hyenas to get back with Nala's meal, Scar asked the cub more probing questions about what her visit with her parents had been like, stoking the fires of the young lioness' anger at the people who had refused to let her eat what she wanted. He could tell that he was getting under her skin from the way she began to pace agitatedly. He fought down a wicked laugh. The pudgy little cub was so manipulable that it was almost charming.

Soon, Scar's hunters returned with a pair of antelope, and Nala dug in gratefully. She ate as though nothing else mattered in the world, happy for the first time since...well, since she'd left Scar's den the last time. Yet even the warm pleasure of eating was tinged with bitterness. As she ate, Nala couldn't help but think about her parents, and how they had wanted to deny her this, her chief joy in life. Well, she would show them. Now she was with someone who accepted her appreciation for food, and who supported her desire to gain weight. She wished Scar had been her father instead of that jerk who tried to stop her from eating.

Nala was so busy thinking angry thoughts that she didn't realize just how much she was eating. She couldn't feel how full she was, so she made her way easily through both of the antelopes, though her recently-starved belly wasn't used to even that much meat. It felt great to have a distended, hanging stomach again. She almost wished her parents could see her now, just so she could taunt them with how much happier she was without them.
1112122112122111112111.title: Back to Scar

11121221121221111121112.content:
Scar kept Nala both contented and hidden for the next couple weeks. He worried that her parents would come searching for her, and his mental manipulation of the cub was a delicate task. He couldn't afford any interruptions. All through that time, he kept Nala stuffed full, presenting her with increasingly huge amounts of food whenever she asked for some.

Due to the constant pampering, Nala had fattened up quite a bit. Her walk had a very pronounced waddle to it--when she bothered to walk at all, which was infrequently--and her gut reached to the ground when she was standing up, not that she spent a lot of time standing, either. Her big stomach oozed out from between her legs when she was sitting; her legs themselves had thickened to the point where they were nearly as big as his own; her neck had nearly disappeared, replaced with rolls of chins that impeded her ability to move her head.

Scar made sure to spoil her as much as he could, catering to her every whim and doing things for her whenever he could. As a result, she became more demanding, less shy and polite about her food requests. He also regularly reminded her of the charmed life she lived with him, as compared to the way her parents wanted her to waste away. He wanted her unshakable loyalty, and he couldn't have her retaining any affection toward the idiots who had birthed her.

Nala, for her part, needed very little convincing to come around to Scar's point of view. Her new life was paradise, and the better it became, the worse her home seemed in comparison. She liked having her every desire fulfilled as soon as she expressed it. And what she mostly desired, of course, was food. She ate almost constantly, hopelessly addicted to the feeling of a distended, overfull stomach. Soon, the two antelope she'd devoured the first day were little more than an appetizer: As she gained weight and stomach capacity, she needed more and more food to get to that blissful bloated state that was her preferred mode of existence.

Then one day, her portions stopped growing. "What's this supposed to be?" she demanded, after being presented with the same amount of food she'd eaten the day before. Irrationally, she found herself growing angry at Scar. Was he really better than her parents if two hartebeests a day was all the food he would give her? Two weeks ago, she would have been grateful for any large quantity of food, but Scar had spoiled her well.

"I apologize, my dear. My hyenas, tragically marginalized as they are, have a limited hunting range. The best hunting ground belongs to the other lions; the hyenas can't set foot there, thanks to king Mufasa." Scar said his brother's name with real venom, which resonated with Nala's own bitterness.

"I wish you were king," she grumbled as she ate her meager meal. Scar smiled wanly.

"Ah, I do as well, Nala. But Mufasa is king, and Simba will be king after him. I'm barely a speck in the line of succession."

Simba. It had been a long time since Nala thought about her friend. She missed him, a bit, but he was an important part of the pride and, as Scar had told her over and over, the pride, like her parents, would hate her for her healthy appetite and try to starve her again. Nala had a little trouble believing that of Simba, but then again, the other cub had never said anything positive about her since she'd started gaining weight. He would be just like all the others.

"I wish Mufasa and Simba would just disappear!" she said angrily. It wasn't fair that they should be able to do whatever they want while she was barely getting anything to eat. Scar's grin stretched wide, displaying his sharp teeth.

"Really?" he said, his voice chastising. "You'd get rid of your best friend just so you could eat whatever you wanted?"

The censure in Scar's voice only strengthened Nala's resolve. It was an idle wish, and she didn't really think it through. Simba and Mufasa were abstract quantities to her at the moment, whereas her personal fulfillment was the most important thing in the world. If she had been face to face with her friend, she might have thought differently.

"Yes," she said determinedly.
11121221121221111121112.title: Machinations

111212211212211111211121.content:
"I'm glad to hear that," Scar said purringly. "You may really be dedicated enough to get truly fat."

"That won't matter if you don't have anything to feed me," Nala retorted. It had been uncomfortable enough when he'd put her on the spot a moment ago. He didn't need to compound the unpleasantness by talking about stupid hypothetical situations.

"Well, we'll just have to redouble our efforts, I suppose. Will you be all right by yourself here if we go off hunting?"

Nala wanted to say that she was afraid she would starve, but she desperately needed more food. If that meant she had to wait here while Scar and the hyenas killed something...she'd have to be okay with that.

"Of course I am. Get going!" she snapped. Scar was still smiling at her, which seemed incongruous, given what a brat she knew she was being. But he didn't say anything else, just turned and left the den, leaving Nala alone.

The next few hours were torture. The hyenas were good hunters, and she was convinced that they'd come back with something. At the same time, she wasn't used to going so long without eating, and her gut let her know that it wasn't happy about not being constantly filled. She felt terrible, but there was nothing she could do about it. There wasn't even anybody around for her to yell at about how they should be feeding her.

This was all Mufasa's fault. The hyenas weren't bad people; there was no reason to bar them from hunting in the same places that lions could hunt. In her hunger and anger, Nala felt that the king had made that rule specifically to make her life worse. Just like her parents and their stupid rules about how much she could eat! Scar was right: all the other lions were exactly the same.

Nala's ruminations were cut short by Scar's return. To the young lioness' delight, the hyenas behind him were bringing in four wildebeest carcasses. The bodies looked strange, almost like they had been squashed to death, but Nala wasn't in a position to be picky. They were food, and that was all she cared about.

"Dig in, my dear," Scar said as the hyenas piled the carcasses in front of her. "There's plenty more where that came from." Nala was awash in gratitude for the dark-furred lion. He'd come through for her, despite all the challenges involved in getting so much food.

She tore into the first wildebeest. It was softer than she was used to her meat being, but that made it easier to swallow, so she certainly wasn't complaining. There must have been nearly a ton of meat there, more than Nala had eaten at one time since coming back to Scar, but she was usually kept totally full. Today, she hadn't eaten in hours, so she had more room to spare in her stomach. The young lioness moaned orgiastically as she ate. She could feel her stomach getting bigger than it had ever been before, immobilizing her by lifting her thick legs off the ground. She was still a young cub, but she was so bloated and monstrously obese that she was nearly half as tall as Scar, and probably at least as heavy.

Usually, such a big meal would leave Nala nearly comatose, but something--the stress of the day, perhaps--kept her wits clear this time. She didn't feel sleepy at all. Heck, she didn't even feel full.

"You said you had more food," she said. "Bring it here."

Scar smiled. "As you wish, my dear. But we could only carry this many animals at a time, so we'll have to go back to get more. I'm afraid that means that you'll have to stay here by yourself again."

"That's fine," Nala said. If there was more food already killed, she wouldn't have to wait for them to hunt.

"Oh, and one more thing, Nala," Scar said, turning around just as he was about to leave the cave. Nala wanted to scream at him to go get her food and stop dawdling.

"Yes?" she said instead, still sounding very impatient.

"If you see Simba, please tell me when I get back. I'm worried about the poor boy." Nala couldn't work up the energy to care about what had happened to make Scar worry about his nephew. She just wanted him to go bring back more wildebeest or whatever.

"I will," she said. With that, Scar bounded away, the hyenas following behind him.
111212211212211111211121.title: The Actual Plot Is Happening

1112122112122111112111211.content:
[[Yes, I'm aware that characters aren't supposed to die in this story, but Mufasa's death is canon, so I assume that referencing it is all right, even if I'm obviously messing with the canon some.]]

All the time she'd been with Scar, Nala hadn't seen anyone she knew, so she was surprised when she saw Simba coming toward the den. Even if she had been mobile, she wouldn't have had the energy nor the desire to go out to him. At one point in her life, she would have wanted nothing more than to bound over to her friend, but now she wasn't interested unless he was hiding a hippo or something. She felt that it wouldn't be too bothersome to call out to him, though. Perhaps having someone to talk to would make the wait more bearable.

"Simba!" The young lion had already been heading toward Scar's den, but he quickened his pace when he heard his name.

"Nala?" he asked, surprised. Though she'd disappeared a couple weeks prior, she was still just about the last person he expected to meet here. He vaguely wondered how she had gotten so fat in such a short time, but he had more pressing issues on his mind. He paced restlessly in a circle around her.

"What are you doing here?" she asked. That simple question made tears form in the corners of Simba's eyes.

"I killed my dad!" he sobbed. Perhaps he shouldn't have been telling her, but he was in no state to think things through. "I w-was in the gorge, and there was a wildebeest stampede, and my dad saved me, b-but..." he trailed off, crying. Nala was somewhat sympathetic to his distress, but her chief thought was that now she knew what was up with the squashed wildebeest: they'd been trampled to death.

"That means you're the king now, doesn't it?" she asked cautiously. Perhaps Mufasa's death could be good luck for her. If Simba became king and she could convince Simba to let the hyenas hunt in the Pridelands, then all her food-supply troubles would be over. But Simba just looked at her like he couldn't believe she'd just said that.

"How can you think about that right now?" he demanded. "My father is dead because of me! And meanwhile, you've been hiding out here turning yourself into a disgusting blob! I shouldn't be surprised that you're thinking about this totally selfishly!"

Nala was taken aback by the vehemence of his response. "I'm sorry," she said quietly, her head hanging as low as it could go. "I didn't mean it like that." Well, yes she had, but she hadn't meant for him to get all worked up about it. He rubbed his eyes with a forepaw.

"I'm sorry too," he said. "I'm just--this is really hard for me. I shouldn't take it out on you." Nala noticed that he didn't actually take back the bit about her being disgusting.

"So what are you doing here?" she asked, in an attempt to change the subject. "If it had been me and my dad, I guess I would have gone home." She was trying to sympathize with her, but all she thought about when she thought about her own father was how he had unfairly restricted her eating habits, so that was a bit of a lie.

"A-after I...well, after, I saw Scar, and he told me to come here so we could talk about what happened. Do you know if he'll be back soon?" If he was going back to the gorge to get more wildebeest, probably not, Nala thought. That was at least half an hour's walk from here (without the added weight of Nala's food), and Simba had only missed his uncle by about ten minutes.

"I don't think so," Nala replied hesitantly. "In an hour or so, maybe." Simba looked up at her with wide, wet eyes.

"I-I don't think I can wait that long. What do you think, Nala? Do you think I should go home?"
1112122112122111112111211.title: Nala's Final Test

11121221121221111121112112.content:
Remembering that he had just called her disgusting, Nala saw this as her chance to get rid of Simba in a completely nonlethal way (which was good, because she knew she wouldn't be able to sanction her friend's death). So she shook her head vehemently, which cased her whole body to wobble.

"No," she said quietly. "I mean, if it was my father, it wouldn't be a big deal, but your dad was the best king the Pridelands ever had." She didn't believe anything of the sort, of course, but she needed to sell this to Simba. "You need to get out of here before anyone realizes what happens. Can you imagine what everyone will say when they find out that you killed Mufasa? You'll be shunned. It's better to strike out on your own now and save yourself all that pain."

"Do you really think so?" Simba asked, obviously about to cry.

"Yeah." Simba nodded despondently and started making his way out of the den. "But Simba? Be careful out there, okay? Just because you have to leave the pride doesn't mean you should do anything stupid." He nodded again, but didn't give her any other acknowledgment.

As Nala watched his small form recede in the distance, she felt a pang of guilt. She had just told her best friend to leave everything he'd ever known, all so she could eat a little more. But, she rationalized, it wasn't as though she could go chase him down and stop him, and he was probably too far away to hear if she yelled. Besides, had her advice really been so bad? If the pride had been willing to try and starve her just because she ate a little more than most lions, what would they do to the cub who killed their king? No, she hadn't just sent him off for selfish reasons.

Despite her intellectual conviction that she hadn't done anything wrong, Nala was still grappling with her guilty conscious when Scar returned. She was relieved to see the lion, and even more relieved to see that Scar had brought another four trampled wildebeest with him. Hopefully, a good stuffing would put her back in her right mind. But when the food was put in front of her, she hesitated.

"What's wrong, Nala?" Scar asked, sounding concerned.

"Simba came by here," she said glumly.

"Oh, and?"

"He said he killed Mufasa!" she blurted. "And he was going to wait for you, but you weren't coming back for a long time, so he asked me what I thought he should do, and I said he should run away!"

"That's quite a bit to take in," Scar said, blinking, "but I think you made a good choice, Nala. The other lions would hate him forever if they knew what happened. Better to let them think he died with his father, and let him live a shame-free life elsewhere." Scar's words relieved Nala immensely. He was a smart lion; if he thought she did the right thing, then she had nothing to worry about. She bent her head to begin eating, but then raised it again. She had one more niggling suspicion that she wanted to put to rest.

"Scar?"

"Yes, my dear?"

"You didn't..." Nala paused, trying to think of the least crazy-sounding way to put it. "You didn't send Simba here on purpose to see what I'd tell him, did you?"

Scar was shocked, but he managed to keep his composure. He hadn't expected his little glutton to be so sharp!
11121221121221111121112112.title: Get Going, Simba!

111212211212211111211121121.content:
"Of course I did," he said, as though it was not at all a big deal.

"What!?" Nala exclaimed, livid. If she had been smaller, she would have reared up, but in her current condition, her reflexive jump just manifested as waves of jiggling fat. "H-how could you make me do that to my best friend!?"

"I had to do it," Scar replied. "I needed to see if you would put your needs above the needs of those closest to you." Nala opened her mouth to protest, but Scar continued before she could say anything. "And let me say that you did beatifully, my dear. You manipulated Simba by pretending that you were thinking of the greater good. It was a selfish, despicable thing to do, and I could not be more proud of you. You got rid of the final obstacle between me and the throne, so you'll be able to eat as much as you like from now on. Because I am the king of the Pridelands now, Nala, and I would be honored if you would be my queen. You've absolutely earned it."
111212211212211111211121121.title: Scar's Confession

choices: Time to move to Pride Rock
1112122112122111112111211211.content:
Nala was horrified. Scar didn't know what he was talking about; she really had recommended what was best for Simba. It was simply lucky that her choice also happened to benefit her. But when she noticed her thoughts drifting from the bombshell Scar had just dropped to the smell of the meat sitting in front of her, realization hit so hard that no amount of denial could wash it away. She didn't care about Simba nearly as much as she cared about eating.

And what was worse was that the realization didn't bother her. Her former friend had had the gall to call her disgusting after killing his own father! Eating, on the other hand, had never brought her anything but happiness. Maybe what she had done was objectively wrong. But it had been the right thing to do to increase her own pleasure, and after weeks of pampered hedonism, that was enough for her. And the only person who had never tried to stop her eating, the only person who'd never been anything but supportive of her gain...was Scar. Without the food he brought her, she would never have been able to gain so much weight so quickly.

She supposed that she loved him, as much as she loved anything that wasn't eating. She was eternally grateful to him, at least, and to her adolescent mind, it was more or less the same thing. Sure, he was kind of underhanded, and he could be pretty scary, but he'd never done anything "bad" that wasn't in Nala's best interest. And, as he had pointed out, she was just the same as him, when one got right down to it.

"Yes," she said decisively. "I would love to be your queen. Can I eat now?"

"Of course, darling," Scar replied, pleased. "I'd like nothing more."

Nala felt his eyes on her as she buried her face in the fresh pile of meat, but it didn't bother her. Letting him admire her was the least she could do after all he'd done for her, both in terms of food and of personal revelations. She had never really thought about the moral ramifications of her eating, but it was clear to her now that if she wanted to keep going down her current path (and there was nothing she wanted more), she would have to give up most of the semblance of a normal life.

Somehow, the thought that she was doing something that most people would classify as "bad" made gluttony all the better. She was eating more than she ever had before, and was probably in real danger of overdoing it, but she didn't care. Her already-mountainous stomach strained to contain all the food she consumed as she continued to gorge herself at a ferocious pace. The four wildebeest disappeared surprisingly quickly, given how much she had already eaten that day.
1112122112122111112111211211.title: Giving In

choices: She keeps herself stuffed to mindlessness
When she wakes up, her guilt is gone
11121221121221111121112112111.content:
"More!" Nala demanded, though she was already panting from the exertion of eating so much. The hyenas didn't move; they just looked up at her, stunned. "You heard me," Nala snapped. "Bring me more food." They nodded and disappeared from her line of vision, only to return a moment later with more wildebeest carcasses. So, Scar had been lying about having to make a long journey, as well. She was miffed that he had withheld food from her, but if she had been in his position, she would have done the same thing, she supposed.

By now, even her prodigious stomach was having some trouble containing all the food she was consuming, but she pressed on regardless, slowing down but never stopping. After everything that had happened that day, this was more than a meal to her: it was an act of defiance. If she was going to be Scar's queen, she had to kill off any remaining doubts that might be lingering in her mind, and with her limited life experience, she could think of no better way to do that than to glut herself until she couldn't think any more. Stuffing herself past the point where even she felt like she'd had enough was the ultimate selfish, decadent act.

Her taut, straining stomach pushed her further and further off the ground until she was taller than Scar. She had visible difficulty forcing down the last few mouthfuls, but she was a practiced overeater, so she managed all right. Once there was no more meat in front of her, Nala took stock of her situation. She'd never eaten so much at once before; the combined weight of all the wildebeest had to have been more than that hippo. Once she digested the massive amount of food she had eaten, she would certainly be wider than she was tall, and she personally doubted that she would ever walk again, not least because she intended to keep herself fed this level.

And yet, she couldn't completely stop feeling bad about Simba. Guilt ate away at her, leaving her feeling hollow. Well, she knew how to deal with a hollow feeling.

"More!" she cried urgently. "And keep it coming until I tell you to stop!" The hyenas obeyed reluctantly. Nala looked over at where Scar lay watching her, silently daring him to tell her to stop. But he only gave her a slow, approving nod. He really was the perfect lion for her, she realized.

Scar watched with interest as his new queen resumed her attempt to drown her better nature in food. Dozens of wildebeest had died during the stampede, so he had no shortage of new meat for her, but the process she was going through fascinated him. He himself had never been burdened with much of a conscious, but Nala had been a perfectly ordinary--if unusually glutinous--cub when he had started feeding her, and through weeks of hard work, he'd brought her to this point, where she was trying to kill her own conscience to be more worthy of him.

Nala, of course, wasn't privy to any of Scar's private thoughts. Somewhere after she lost track of exactly how many wildebeest she had consumed, something snapped inside her mind. All conscious thought drained away, replaced by a feeling of glutted bliss. She stopped eating mid-wildebeest; she had thought that there was no greater pleasure to be had in life than eating past fullness, but this mindless, orgiastic state was so far beyond that that no amount of eating could improve it.
11121221121221111121112112111.title: More!

choices: Scar is pleased by the way she's developing
Scar wants to snap her out of it
111212211212211111211121121111.content:
Nala soon found that eating herself into a mindless stupor was more of a necessity than a pleasure. Oh, sure, it still felt great, but it was an addicting feeling. Whenever she dipped below a certain threshold of overfullness, guilt over everything she'd done to get to this point would assault her, and to her addled mind, the guilt seemed worse every time it reoccurred.

Her queendom was thus much like her initial couple of weeks with Scar. Instead of the lion keeping her over-satiated for some nefarious purpose, though, the young queen was doing it to herself in order to preserve what she thought of as her sanity. She only barely registered the change when she and Scar moved into Mufasa's old den (and she definitely could not have said how she was moved there), and she never knew what was going on around her.

Heck, she never knew what was going on inside her. She had to stuff herself continuously to maintain the drugged state she so preferred, but she was so preoccupied with not having to think about the choices she'd made that she didn't even realize what her food intake was doing to her body. Forget spherical, Nala was nearly pyramidal, with her huge gut flowing out beneath her. "Distended" quickly became her stomach's normal mode of existence, and once that was normal, absolutely monstrous further distension wasn't a big deal. Nala was nearly as big as a hippo, and though, as she'd grown into an adult lioness, her body had gotten quite a bit longer, there was no way it could have kept pace with her gluttony. Fat collected in thick sheets all over her body, until she couldn't even move her tail, but most of the nutrients she consumed went to increasing her stomach capacity, since her body had long ago realized that that was its best bet for not exploding.

As such, her eating capacity increased quickly, and, of course, she never just ate to capacity. What had once made her mind-breakingly overfull soon just made her full, and "just full" was nowhere near good enough.
111212211212211111211121121111.title: Eating Machine

1112122112122111112111211211112.content:
Scar was torn about his queen's behavior. On the one paw, she certainly was beautiful. He himself had never had much use for eating, seeing it more as an annoying necessity than a pleasure. Still, he was impressed by Nala's willingness to completely give her life over to fulfilling (and more than fulfilling) her most basic desires, without a thought for the rest of the world. It was a shame that she was far too heavy to ever have cubs; Scar would have loved to bring more lions just like her into the world. Her hugely fattened body definitely didn't hurt his opinion of her, either. When he'd first started fattening her up, more than a year ago now, he had expected that she would quickly become ugly as she gained weight, but that hadn't happened at all.

On the other paw, though, he had groomed her to be his companion, not just a pretty object. The rest of the pride didn't like him much, and the feeling was definitely mutual. Therefore, he didn't have anyone to talk to besides the hyenas, and hyenas were dumb as rocks. He'd put so much work into making Nala just like him. He loved her for her unbridled gluttony, but he couldn't have it completely overtake the wonderful personality he'd worked so hard to shape. So he plotted about what was the best way to bring his queen back to reality.
1112122112122111112111211211112.title: Lonely Scar

11121221121221111121112112111121.content:
As much as it pained him, Scar knew that the only way he could get Nala to pay any attention to him was to strategically withhold food. He certainly didn't want to starve her, and he knew that he would have to walk a very fine line between getting her head out of the clouds and making her resent her the same way she resented her parents. It took him a few days, but eventually he came up with a plan that he thought would work.

Scar always attended to his kingly duties in the same open area where Nala was, to show the pride that he was a powerful and prosperous enough ruler to keep such an obese mate. To set his plan into action, he let her food run out while he was hearing testimony from a lioness who was accused of abandoning the pride's cubs in a dangerous situation.

When Nala couldn't find any food, she looked around in something like a panic, making eye contact with her mate for the first time in weeks. "Scar!" she cried desperately, feeling the guilt creep in at the edges of her mind. "I need more food!"

"In a moment, darling," he said dismissively. "I'm right in the middle of some very important business." Nala moaned impatiently. In all the time since she'd become the queen, this had never happened before. "If you would help me deliberate, I'm sure the process would go more quickly." She acquiesced petulantly, and he explained the situation to her, then sent the other lioness out of the room so they could talk it over.

Nala couldn't understand why Scar was making her get involved in the pride's stupid politics. He knew how uncomfortable she got when she wasn't eating. But then she saw the wicked smirk on his face, and she realized what he wanted from her. Scar was a cruel lion (never to her, of course, but she doubted if he valued anyone besides the two of them), and he liked it when she was cruel as well. But despite her best intentions, she always felt awful afterward, which in turn made her few lucid moments so much worse.
11121221121221111121112112111121.title: A Delicate Operation

111212211212211111211121121111212.content:
Nala took a deep breath to steady herself (as if her enormous stomach didn't anchor her firmly to the ground!). "Protecting the cubs is one of the most important jobs in the pride. Let the hyenas have her." Inwardly, Nala was quaking, but her distress subsided a bit when she saw her mate's smile widen. If he was happy, it was worth a little extra guilt. It wasn't as though she cared about the lioness, or had any moral objections to punishing her.

Scar purred and nuzzled Nala's huge gut affectionately. She was a little startled: he wasn't the most demonstratively affectionate mate in the world, and she wasn't even sure that he found her physically attractive. Oh, he said he did, but she had long suspected that that was just so she didn't feel like she was somehow letting him down by continuing to gain weight. But he certainly seemed pleased with her now.

"I think that that is an excellent idea, my queen," he whispered in his silkiest voice. She wished that she could nuzzle him back, but there was no way her head or even any of her limbs could reach all the way down to him.

More than that, though, she was grateful when he called for more food to be brought to her. He had given her quite a bit to think about, and she would be happy to dismiss this as some weird whim of his and go back to not thinking at all.

But it kept happening. Her food supply was becoming distressingly erratic, and, suspiciously, it only seemed to run out when Scar was doing some sort of kingly business that he wanted her input on. Because she wanted to keep him happy, she always advised the cruelest thing she could think of, and in return, he showed her affection and resumed feeding her.
111212211212211111211121121111212.title: What He Wants

1112122112122111112111211211112121.content:
And then, one day, she just...didn't feel bad any more. She had ordered a young adult lion beaten for some infraction, but the usual guilt didn't hit her like a charging elephant. She held her breath, waiting for it to descend, but it never did. Her mate was whispering sweet nothings to her, hyenas were piling more food in front of her, and Nala was content.

She was more than content, in fact. She felt great! Out of habit, she started eating again, and was surprised at just how flavorful the meat was when she wasn't trying to stuff it down as fast as possible. She'd forgotten how good it felt to just eat with no specific goal in mind; it was ecstasy. She moaned with pleasure, which caused her whole body to jiggle, every useless inch of her. To an observer, the ripples that moved along her vast form would have looked like savannah grass rippling in the wind. Nala was actually a little surprised by how huge she'd gotten, and she wished she had managed to get over that whole "conscience" thing a lot sooner. One downside of eating herself comatose all the time was that she hadn't been able to appreciate her growing body.

And grown it had. Her limbs and tail had all but vanished beneath huge rolls of fat, making her whole body more or less one continuous blob. Underneath that fat, her legs more closely resembled puddles than usable limbs, being spreading masses of fat that had long ago atrophied into uselessness even as they continued to increase in bulk. Her stomach pushed her up so her "shoulders" (as much as any part of her monstrously obese body could be considered a shoulder) were more than three times as high as Scar's, and she was of course much, much wider, a veritable ocean of oozing, corpulent flesh, of which she could barely move a muscle.

It occurred to her, all of a sudden, that she would never walk again. That had been true for some time, of course, and she'd suspected as much for even longer, but at this moment, while taking stock of her massive body, she knew that she had passed the point of no return. She was nothing but a burden now, consuming and consuming and never giving anything back. The thought thrilled her endlessly, sent her into paroxysms of delight that would have had her thrashing if she had been able to move.
